Zooming with our Pen Pals. Students in Mrs. Cowherd’s fourth-grade class and Mrs. Franklin’s class have been writing letters back and forth all year. It has been such a great experience for our students to practice their writing skills all year with a friend. There is so much more motivation when they know there is a real recipient behind the letter, and knowing they will get mail back. The student’s eyes would light up when pen pal letters arrived at the school. Mrs. Franklin’s class is from Mazon. We had been talking about having a picnic for the students at the end of the year so students could meet each other face to face. We had already taken a class picture and sent it to each classroom in January. It was time to meet face to face. Then, we were sent home for e-learning. Mrs. Franklin suggested a Zoom meeting so we could still see each other face to face. We had 35 students participate in our Zoom meeting. It was great to “see” each other even though we were not able to get together.
http://edl.io/n1224083

Love and Math were in the air in the month of February!
The kids have been learning about place value. I found some Valentine Place Value activities for the students to practice number identification and identifying digits in the tens place, and the ones place. They also used Unifix Cubes to give hand-ons and visual support. Another way we practice place value is by counting the number of days we have been in school this school year. We add a dot to a tens frame each day we have been in school. When a tens frame is full, we count by tens. When a tens frame is not full we count by ones. Switching counting by tens and ones is a great skill for the students to learn, as it also helps with counting money. I think pairing specific skills with other things happening in your classroom/building helps the students become more interested and engaged http://edl.io/n1178115
